name: UpdateWebExperimentStatus
description:
Update the status of a web experiment.

Use this tool to update the status or data of an existing web experiment within a specific project by providing the relevant identifiers.

parameters.name: project_id_for_access
parameters.description: Project ID to access the specific project. Obtain it via /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: web_experiment_id
parameters.description: A unique integer identifying the web experiment.

parameters.name: experiment_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the web experiment that needs to be updated.

parameters.name: experiment_name
parameters.description: The name of the web experiment to be updated. This should be a descriptive string identifying the specific experiment within the project.

parameters.name: creation_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp when the web experiment was created. Must be in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z').

parameters.name: feature_flag_key
parameters.description: A string representing the feature flag key associated with the web experiment. It uniquely identifies the feature toggle you want to update.

parameters.name: web_experiment_variants
parameters.description: JSON string defining the variants for the web experiment. Include text, HTML, selector, conditions, and rollout percentage for each variant. Example: { "control": { "transforms": [ { "text": "Here comes Superman!", "html": "", "selector": "#page > #body > .header h1" } ], "conditions": "None", "rollout_percentage": 50 } }

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this web experiment.

value_schema.description: A unique integer value identifying this web experiment.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: variants
